drug.name: Exisulind

article.citation: Authors unspecified: Exisulind: Aptosyn, FGN 1, Prevatac, sulindac sulfone. Drugs R D. 2004;5(4):220-6.

Piazza GA, Thompson WJ, Pamukcu R, Alila HW, Whitehead CM, Liu L, Fetter JR, Gresh WE Jr, Klein-Szanto AJ, Farnell DR, Eto I, Grubbs CJ: Exisulind, a novel proapoptotic drug, inhibits rat urinary bladder tumorigenesis. Cancer Res. 2001 May 15;61(10):3961-8.

Thompson WJ, Piazza GA, Li H, Liu L, Fetter J, Zhu B, Sperl G, Ahnen D, Pamukcu R: Exisulind induction of apoptosis involves guanosine 3',5'-cyclic monophosphate phosphodiesterase inhibition, protein kinase G activation, and attenuated beta-catenin. Cancer Res. 2000 Jul 1;60(13):3338-42.

drug.indication: Investigated for use/treatment in adenomatous polyposis coli, lung cancer, prostate cancer, colon polyps, Barrett's esophagus disease, and pediatric indications.
drug.mechanism-of-action: Exisulind is a sulindac derivative of a class of compounds called selective apoptotic anti-neoplastic drugs (SAANDs), which inhibit the enzyme cyclic guanosine monophosphodiesterase (cGMP - PDE). Exisulind is specific for apoptotic effects in precancerous and cancerous colorectal cells due to their overexpression of cGMP. Sustained elevation of cGMP and protein kinase G (PKG) activation may be also implicated in the induction of apoptosis by Exisulind.

category.category: Compounds used in a research, industrial, or household setting

drug-interaction.name: Darbepoetin alfa
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Darbepoetin alfa is combined with Exisulind.

drug-interaction.name: Erythropoietin
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Erythropoietin is combined with Exisulind.

drug-interaction.name: Peginesatide
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Peginesatide is combined with Exisulind.

drug-interaction.name: Methoxy polyethylene glycol-epoetin beta
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Methoxy polyethylene glycol-epoetin beta is combined with Exisulind.

polypeptide.name: cAMP-specific 3',5'-cyclic phosphodiesterase 4D
polypeptide.specific-function: Hydrolyzes the second messenger cAMP, which is a key regulator of many important physiological processes.

polypeptide.name: cAMP-specific 3',5'-cyclic phosphodiesterase 4C
polypeptide.specific-function: Hydrolyzes the second messenger cAMP, which is a key regulator of many important physiological processes.

polypeptide.name: cGMP-specific 3',5'-cyclic phosphodiesterase
polypeptide.specific-function: Plays a role in signal transduction by regulating the intracellular concentration of cyclic nucleotides. This phosphodiesterase catalyzes the specific hydrolysis of cGMP to 5'-GMP (PubMed:9714779, PubMed:15489334). Specifically regulates nitric-oxide-generated cGMP (PubMed:15489334).

go-classifier.description: negative regulation of cardiac muscle contraction
negative regulation of T cell proliferation
positive regulation of cardiac muscle hypertrophy
positive regulation of MAP kinase activity

polypeptide.name: cGMP-dependent 3',5'-cyclic phosphodiesterase
polypeptide.specific-function: Cyclic nucleotide phosphodiesterase with a dual-specificity for the second messengers cAMP and cGMP, which are key regulators of many important physiological processes.Isoform PDE2A2: Regulates Mitochondrial cAMP Levels and Respiration.

cellular response to macrophage colony-stimulating factor stimulus
cellular response to transforming growth factor beta stimulus
negative regulation of cAMP biosynthetic process

negative regulation of transcription from RNA polymerase II promoter

article.citation: Nobuoka A, Takayama T, Miyanishi K, Sato T, Takanashi K, Hayashi T, Kukitsu T, Sato Y, Takahashi M, Okamoto T, Matsunaga T, Kato J, Oda M, Azuma T, Niitsu Y: Glutathione-S-transferase P1-1 protects aberrant crypt foci from apoptosis induced by deoxycholic acid. Gastroenterology. 2004 Aug;127(2):428-43.

polypeptide.name: Glutathione S-transferase P
polypeptide.specific-function: Conjugation of reduced glutathione to a wide number of exogenous and endogenous hydrophobic electrophiles. Regulates negatively CDK5 activity via p25/p35 translocation to prevent neurodegeneration.

article.citation: Zheng X, Zhang L, Zhai J, Chen Y, Luo H, Hu X: The molecular basis for inhibition of sulindac and its metabolites towards human aldose reductase. FEBS Lett. 2012 Jan 2;586(1):55-9. doi: 10.1016/j.febslet.2011.11.023. Epub 2011 Dec 8.

polypeptide.name: Aldose reductase
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the NADPH-dependent reduction of a wide variety of carbonyl-containing compounds to their corresponding alcohols with a broad range of catalytic efficiencies.

go-classifier.description: maternal process involved in female pregnancy
positive regulation of smooth muscle cell proliferation

article.citation: Cousido-Siah A, Ruiz FX, Crespo I, Porte S, Mitschler A, Pares X, Podjarny A, Farres J: Structural analysis of sulindac as an inhibitor of aldose reductase and AKR1B10. Chem Biol Interact. 2015 Jun 5;234:290-6. doi: 10.1016/j.cbi.2014.12.018. Epub 2014 Dec 20.

polypeptide.name: Aldo-keto reductase family 1 member B10
polypeptide.specific-function: Acts as all-trans-retinaldehyde reductase. Can efficiently reduce aliphatic and aromatic aldehydes, and is less active on hexoses (in vitro). May be responsible for detoxification of reactive aldehydes in the digested food before the nutrients are passed on to other organs.
